content.text:
# 1985 Alan King Tennis Classic – Singles

Johan Kriek
| runner =  Jimmy Arias
| score  = 4–6, 6–4, 6–3, 6–2
| type   = singles doubles
| before_year = 1983
| after_year = no
| draw   = 32 (3/4)
| seeds  = 8
}}
Jimmy Connors was the defending champion in 1983. He lost in the first round to Vijay Amritraj.
Johan Kriek won the title by defeating Jimmy Arias 4–6, 6–4, 6–3, 6–2 in the final.
Seeds
Jimmy Connors (first round)
#  Kevin Curren (first round)
#  Aaron Krickstein (first round)
#  Pat Cash (first round)
#  Eliot Teltscher (quarterfinals)
#  Tomáš Šmíd (semifinals)
#  Scott Davis (second round)
#  Tim Mayotte (quarterfinals)
}}
